result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Christopher Dortch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit for zero days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during term of probation or civil judgment.

No new violations of the law.
No new retail theft tickets.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Christopher Dortch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven Christopher Dortch in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Steven Christopher Dortch in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for  zero  days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for two years with the following conditions:
* no new violations of the law
* no new retail theft tickets
* pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during term of probation or civil judgment 

 Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Steven Christopher Dortch not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-28-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Steven Christopher Dortch not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-19-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Pick N Save 1717 N Mayfair Rd, Wauwatosa WI.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Steven Christopher Dortch in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  
Defendant Steven Christopher Dortch in custody.   
Zachery A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Status conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
